intro: Galium aparine f. spurium, commonly known as bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and slender, hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and have a distinctive notched or toothed margin. Galium aparine f. spurium is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
